claim_0001.claim_text: Measurements of resistivity, thermal expansion, specific heat, and Seebeck coefficient show anomalies at certain temperatures (T*) for LaO0.5F0.5Bi1-xPbxS2 (x≥0.08).

claim_0002.claim_text: Large thermal expansion anomalies, specific heat anomalies, and the existence of hystereses in the resistivity, thermal expansion, specific heat, and Seebeck coefficient measurements indicate a first-order structural phase transition at T* in LaO0.5F0.5Bi1-xPbxS2 (x≥0.08).

physical_attributes.Subject: LaO0.5F0.5Bi1-xPbxS2 (x≥0.08)
physical_attributes.Effect: First-order structural phase transition at T*

claim_0003.claim_text: The anomalies at T* in LaO0.5F0.5Bi1-xPbxS2 (x≥0.08) are related to both the lattice system and the electronic system.

claim_0004.claim_text: Superconductivity is not observed above 2 K at x=0.08 in LaO0.5F0.5Bi1-xPbxS2.

claim_0005.claim_text: The suppression of superconductivity around the structural phase boundary at x=0.08 suggests a close relationship between the lattice structure and superconductivity in LaO0.5F0.5Bi1-xPbxS2.

claim_0006.claim_text: The crystal structure of Bi4O4S3 consists of stacking of Bi4O4(SO4)1-x and Bi2S4 layers; the parent compound (x = 0) is Bi6O8S5.

claim_0007.claim_text: Bi4O4S3 (x = 0.5) is metallic while Bi6O8S5 (x = 0) is a band insulator with Bi3+.

claim_0008.claim_text: The Fermi level for Bi4O4S3 is just on the peak position of the partial density of states of the Bi 6p orbital within the BiS2 layer.

claim_0009.claim_text: The Tc onset and Tc zero are 8.6 K and 4.5 K at 0 T, respectively, for Bi4O4S3.

claim_0010.claim_text: The broadness of the superconducting transition in Bi4O4S3 is probably caused by an inhomogeneity of the local structure and/or carrier doping level.

claim_0011.claim_text: The crystal structure of LaO1-xFxBiS2 is composed of a stacking of BiS2 superconducting layers and spacer layers.

physical_attributes.Subject: LaO1-xFxBiS2
physical_attributes.Effect: Stacking of BiS2 superconducting layers and spacer layers

claim_0012.claim_text: Superconductivity in LaO1-xFxBiS2 originates from the BiS2 layers.

claim_0013.claim_text: A superconducting transition is observed for LaO1-xFxBiS2 with a nominal F concentration (x) ≥ 0.5.

claim_0014.claim_text: The shielding volume fraction in the magnetic susceptibility measurement is only 13.4 % for the best sample of LaO1-xFxBiS2 with x = 0.5.

claim_0015.claim_text: High pressure annealing causes the (004) peak to shift to higher angles in LaO1-xFxBiS2, indicating a decrease in the c axis.

physical_attributes.Subject: LaO1-xFxBiS2
physical_attributes.Effect: Shift of (004) peak to higher angles, decrease in c axis

claim_0016.claim_text: High pressure annealing increases the F concentration in LaO1-xFxBiS2.

claim_0017.claim_text: Resistivity, Hall effect, and magnetization measurements have been performed on the new superconductor Bi4O4S3.

claim_0018.claim_text: Applying a high magnetic field induces a weak insulating behavior in the normal state of Bi4O4S3.

claim_0019.claim_text: Hall effect measurements in Bi4O4S3 reveal a multiband feature dominated by electron charge carriers.

claim_0020.claim_text: Magnetoresistance data in Bi4O4S3 supports the multiband feature observed in Hall effect measurements.

claim_0021.claim_text: A kink appears on the temperature dependence of resistivity in Bi4O4S3 at approximately 4 K at all high magnetic fields when bulk superconductivity is suppressed.

claim_0022.claim_text: The kink in the resistivity of Bi4O4S3 at 4 K is attributed to the upper critical field Hc2(T) in the low field region.

claim_0023.claim_text: The kink in the resistivity of Bi4O4S3 at 4 K is interpreted as possible evidence of residual Cooper pairs on the one-dimensional chains.

claim_0024.claim_text: A phase diagram of Bi4O4S3 has been constructed based on transport and magnetization measurements.

claim_0025.claim_text: NdO1-xFxBiS2 with F-doping can be synthesized by a solid-state reaction under ambient pressure.

claim_0026.claim_text: NdO1-xFxBiS2 is composed of superconducting BiS2 layers and blocking NdO layers.

physical_attributes.Subject: NdO1-xFxBiS2
physical_attributes.Effect: Composition of BiS2 layers and NdO layers

claim_0027.claim_text: Chemical pressure promotes F substitution in NdO1-xFxBiS2, originating from the exchange of La by Nd.

claim_0028.claim_text: The BiS2 layer is the common superconducting layer in BiS2-based superconductors.

claim_0029.claim_text: Polycrystalline samples of Bi4O4S3 are successfully synthesized by a one-step solid-state reaction method using Bi, S and Bi2O3 powders.

physical_attributes.Subject: Bi4O4S3
physical_attributes.Driver: Solid-state reaction method using Bi, S and Bi2O3 powders

claim_0030.claim_text: The superconducting transition temperature (Tconset) of Bi4O4S3 is 4.5 K.

claim_0031.claim_text: The zero resistance transition temperature (Tc0) of Bi4O4S3 is 4.07 K.

claim_0032.claim_text: The diamagnetic transition temperature of Bi4O4S3 is 4.02 K at H=10 Oe.

physical_attributes.Subject: Bi4O4S3
physical_attributes.Effect: Diamagnetic transition temperature = 4.02 K at H=10 Oe

claim_0033.claim_text: Bi4O4S3 exhibits typical type II-superconductor behavior.

claim_0034.claim_text: Bi4O4S3 synthesized at 5000C by vacuum encapsulation technique exhibits bulk superconductivity with a superconducting transition temperature (Tc) of 4.4K.

claim_0035.claim_text: AC and DC magnetization measurements of Bi4O4S3 confirmed closed loops with clear signatures of flux pinning and irreversible behavior.

physical_attributes.Subject: Bi4O4S3
physical_attributes.Effect: Closed loops with flux pinning and irreversible behavior

claim_0036.claim_text: The lower critical field (Hc1) at 2K of Bi4O4S3 is found to be ~39 Oe.

claim_0037.claim_text: Magneto-transport R(T, H) measurements of Bi4O4S3 showed a resistive broadening and decrease in Tc (R=0) to lower temperatures with increasing magnetic field.

claim_0038.claim_text: The extrapolated upper critical field Hc2(0) of Bi4O4S3 is ~310 kOe with a corresponding Ginzburg-Landau coherence length of ~100 Å.

claim_0039.claim_text: The LaO0.5F0.5BiS2 sample was synthesized using a conventional solid-state route via vacuum encapsulation technique at 800°C for 12 hours.

physical_attributes.Subject: LaO0.5F0.5BiS2
physical_attributes.Driver: Conventional solid-state route, vacuum encapsulation technique, 800°C for 12 hours

claim_0040.claim_text: LaO0.5F0.5BiS2 crystallizes in the tetragonal P4/nmm space group with lattice parameters a = 4.0703(5)Å and c = 13.3902(4)Å.

physical_attributes.Effect: Crystallization in P4/nmm space group, a = 4.0703(5)Å, c = 13.3902(4)Å

claim_0041.claim_text: LaO0.5F0.5BiS2 exhibits bulk superconductivity with a superconducting transition temperature (Tc) of 2.7K.

claim_0042.claim_text: Isothermal magnetization (MH) measurements of LaO0.5F0.5BiS2 showed closed loops with clear signatures of flux pinning and irreversible behavior.

physical_attributes.Subject: LaO0.5F0.5BiS2
physical_attributes.Effect: Closed loops in MH measurements, flux pinning, irreversible behavior

claim_0043.claim_text: Resistivity measurements confirmed an onset Tc of 2.7K for LaO0.5F0.5BiS2.

claim_0044.claim_text: Magneto-transport ρ(T,H) measurements of LaO0.5F0.5BiS2 showed resistive broadening and a decrease in Tc (ρ=0) to lower temperatures with increasing magnetic field.

claim_0045.claim_text: The normal state resistivity of LaO0.5F0.5BiS2 is semiconducting.

claim_0046.claim_text: Electrical resistivity measurements under pressure show that Tc in metallic Bi4O4S3 decreases monotonically with increasing pressure.

claim_0047.claim_text: Electrical resistivity measurements under pressure show that Tc in semiconducting LaO0.5F0.5BiS2 initially increases and then decreases upon approaching the metallic region.

physical_attributes.Subject: LaO0.5F0.5BiS2
physical_attributes.Effect: Increase and then decrease of Tc

claim_0048.claim_text: The strong suppression of the semiconducting behavior in LaO0.5F0.5BiS2 suggests that the Fermi surface is in the vicinity of some instability.

claim_0049.claim_text: The Fermi level is located near the edge of the conduction band in LaO0.5F0.5BiS2.

claim_0050.claim_text: Specific heat experiments on a well-characterized polycrystalline sample of Bi4O4S3 reveal a clear specific heat anomaly at about Tc = 4.4 K.

physical_attributes.Subject: Bi4O4S3
physical_attributes.Effect: Specific heat anomaly at Tc = 4.4 K

claim_0051.claim_text: The Tc of Bi4O4S3, estimated by specific heat measurements, is 4.4 K.

claim_0052.claim_text: The superconductivity of Bi4O4S3 is bulk in nature.

claim_0053.claim_text: High-pressure (HP) synthesis of Bi4O4S3 resulted in a sample with lattice parameters and normal-state resistivity comparable to previously reported values.

physical_attributes.Subject: Bi4O4S3
physical_attributes.Effect: Comparable lattice parameters and normal-state resistivity

claim_0054.claim_text: Electron probe microanalysis of Bi4O4S3 revealed the presence of superconducting impurities.

claim_0055.claim_text: The superconducting properties observed in Bi4O4S3 are likely driven by impurities, not the bulk BiS2 layered phase.

claim_0056.claim_text: The superconducting shielding fraction of the impurities in Bi4O4S3 was smaller than 0.3%.

claim_0057.claim_text: Electric transport measurement indicates that SrFBiS2 is a semiconductor between 2 K and 300 K.

claim_0058.claim_text: Thermal transport measurement shows that SrFBiS2 has a small thermal conductivity and a large Seebeck coefficient.

physical_attributes.Subject: SrFBiS2

claim_0060.claim_text: SrFBiS2 contains a NaCl-type BiS2 layer similar to Bi4O4S3 and Ln(O, F)BiS2 superconductors.

claim_0061.claim_text: The superconducting transition temperature (TC) decreases gradually and is suppressed for x>0.10 in polycrystalline Bi4-xAgxO4S3 (0<x<0.2).

claim_0062.claim_text: The resistivity of Bi4-xAgxO4S3 changes from metallic behavior for x<0.1 to semiconductor-like behavior for x>0.1.

claim_0065.claim_text: The superconductivity in the parent Bi4O4S3 is intrinsic.

claim_0066.claim_text: The newly discovered material PrO0.5F0.5BiS2 belongs to the layered sulfide based REO0.5F0.5BiS2 compounds having ZrCuSiAs type structure.

claim_0067.claim_text: The as synthesized PrO0.5F0.5BiS2 is crystallized in tetragonal P4/nmm space group with lattice parameters a = 4.015(5) Å, c = 13.362(4) Å.

claim_0068.claim_text: Bulk superconductivity is observed in PrO0.5F0.5BiS2 below 4K from magnetic and transport measurements.

claim_0069.claim_text: Electrical transport measurements showed superconducting transition temperature (Tc) onset at 3.7K and Tc (ρ=0) at 3.1K in PrO0.5F0.5BiS2.

claim_0070.claim_text: A Schottky-type anomaly is observed at below ~6K in the heat capacity measurement of PrO0.5F0.5BiS2.

claim_0071.claim_text: PrO0.5F0.5BiS2 is slightly semiconducting in the normal state.

claim_0072.claim_text: Isothermal magnetization (MH) exhibited typical type II behavior with lower critical field (Hc1) of around 8Oe in PrO0.5F0.5BiS2.

claim_0073.claim_text: A near single phase PrO0.5F0.5BiS2 compound was synthesized, which is bulk superconducting at 3.7K.

claim_0074.claim_text: The compound PrO0.5F0.5BiS2 is a type II superconductor with lower [Hc1 (2.1K)] of around 8Oe.

claim_0075.claim_text: High pressure annealing strongly affects the lattice of LaO1-xFxBiS2 compared to LaO1-xFxBiS2 samples prepared by conventional solid-state reaction at ambient pressure.

claim_0076.claim_text: Bulk superconductivity was observed in LaO1-xFxBiS2 within a wide F-concentration range of x = 0.2 ~ 0.7.

claim_0077.claim_text: The optimal superconducting properties in LaO1-xFxBiS2 were obtained for x = 0.5 with a Tc onset exceeding 10 K.

claim_0080.claim_text: Chalcogenides tend to crystallize in a layered structure.

claim_0081.claim_text: Intercalations/deintercalations of ions or molecules at the interlayer site of chalcogenides dramatically changes the physical properties and induces exotic superconductivity.

claim_0082.claim_text: The Fe chalcogenides are the simplest Fe-based superconductors.

claim_0083.claim_text: The suppression of antiferromagnetism of Fe planes and the reduction of magnetic moment of excess Fe at the interlayer site are key factors to induce superconductivity in Fe chalcogenides.

claim_0084.claim_text: The reduction of magnetic moment of excess Fe in Fe chalcogenides can be achieved by oxygen intercalation via annealing in oxygen condition or deintercalation of excess Fe via annealing in acid.

claim_0085.claim_text: Red wine is the most effective solution for reducing the magnetic moment of excess Fe in Fe chalcogenides.

claim_0086.claim_text: The BiS2 layer is likely to play an important role in the superconductivity of BiS2-based superconductors.

claim_0087.claim_text: New BiS2-based superconductors can be created with various blocking layers.

claim_0088.claim_text: Density-functional perturbation theory with structural optimization indicates that the electron-phonon coupling constant (lambda) for LaO0.5F0.5BiS2 is equal to 0.8.

claim_0089.claim_text: Density-functional perturbation theory with structural optimization predicts a superconducting transition temperature (Tc) of 9.1 K for LaO0.5F0.5BiS2.

claim_0090.claim_text: Density-functional perturbation theory with structural optimization indicates that LaO1-xFxBiS2 changes from a band insulator at x = 0 to a band metal upon doping.

claim_0098.claim_text: First-principles calculations indicate that the Fermi surface of LaO0.5F0.5BiS2 adopts a 2D-like topology.

claim_0152.claim_text: Both LaO0.5F0.5BiS2 and CeO0.5F0.5BiS2 exhibit transient behavior in the region between the lower Tc phase near atmospheric pressure and the higher Tc phase.

claim_0153.claim_text: The transient behavior in LaO0.5F0.5BiS2 and CeO0.5F0.5BiS2 is characterized by a broadening of the superconducting transition, in which Tc and the transition width, delta Tc, are reversible with increasing and decreasing pressure.

physical_attributes.Subject: LaO0.5F0.5BiS2, CeO0.5F0.5BiS2
physical_attributes.Effect: Broadening of superconducting transition, reversible Tc and delta Tc with pressure

claim_0154.claim_text: There is an appreciable pressure-induced and hysteretic suppression of semiconducting behavior up to the pressure at which the maximum value of Tc is found in LaO0.5F0.5BiS2 and CeO0.5F0.5BiS2.

physical_attributes.Subject: LaO0.5F0.5BiS2, CeO0.5F0.5BiS2
physical_attributes.Driver: Pressure up to the maximum Tc pressure

claim_0155.claim_text: At pressures above the value at which the maximum in Tc occurs, there is a gradual decrease of Tc and further suppression of the semiconducting behavior with pressure, both of which are reversible in LaO0.5F0.5BiS2 and CeO0.5F0.5BiS2.

physical_attributes.Subject: LaO0.5F0.5BiS2, CeO0.5F0.5BiS2
physical_attributes.Effect: Decrease in Tc and suppression of semiconducting behavior

claim_0156.claim_text: There is a striking enhancement of superconductivity accompanying the suppression of semiconducting behavior with pressure in the LnO0.5F0.5BiS2 compounds (Ln = La, Ce) at critical pressures of ∼1.1 GPa and ∼2.0 GPa for Ln = La and Ce, respectively.

physical_attributes.Subject: LnO0.5F0.5BiS2 (Ln = La, Ce)
physical_attributes.Effect: Enhancement of superconductivity and suppression of semiconducting behavior

claim_0157.claim_text: Electrical resistivity measurements reveal that for both LaO0.5F0.5BiS2 and CeO0.5F0.5BiS2, the suppression of their semiconducting behavior is hysteretic upon application of pressure.

claim_0158.claim_text: The pressure dependence of the electrical resistivity exhibits hysteresis below a critical pressure where there is a change in slope of log(ρ) vs. P and where the maximum value of Tc is observed in LaO0.5F0.5BiS2 and CeO0.5F0.5BiS2.

claim_0159.claim_text: The superconducting transition temperature (Tc) of PrO0.5F0.5BiS2 increases with pressure at a rate of dTc/dP=0.45/GPa.

claim_0160.claim_text: Applying hydrostatic external or internal chemical pressure via suitable on-site substitutions may increase the superconducting transition temperature (Tc) of PrO0.5F0.5BiS2.

claim_0161.claim_text: The superconducting transition temperature (Tc) of PrO0.5F0.5BiS2 is monotonically enhanced from 3.7 to 4.7K under a hydrostatic pressure of 2.19GPa.

claim_0162.claim_text: The positive pressure coefficient of PrO0.5F0.5BiS2 superconductors denotes the possibility of a strong inherent carrier interaction on DOS at N(EF) under pressure.

physical_attributes.Subject: PrO0.5F0.5BiS2
physical_attributes.Effect: Strong carrier interaction on DOS at N(EF)

claim_0163.claim_text: PrO0.5F0.5BiS2 exhibits superconductivity with a critical temperature Tc of 3.5 K at lower pressures.

claim_0164.claim_text: NdO0.5F0.5BiS2 exhibits superconductivity with a critical temperature Tc of 3.9 K at lower pressures.

claim_0165.claim_text: As pressure is increased, both PrO0.5F0.5BiS2 and NdO0.5F0.5BiS2 undergo a transition at a pressure Pt from a low Tc superconducting phase to a high Tc superconducting phase.

physical_attributes.Subject: PrO0.5F0.5BiS2, NdO0.5F0.5BiS2
physical_attributes.Effect: Transition from low Tc to high Tc superconducting phase

claim_0166.claim_text: The pressure-induced transition in both PrO0.5F0.5BiS2 and NdO0.5F0.5BiS2 is characterized by a rapid increase in Tc within a small pressure range of ~0.3 GPa.

claim_0167.claim_text: In PrO0.5F0.5BiS2, the transition pressure Pt correlates with the pressure where the suppression of semiconducting behavior saturates.

claim_0168.claim_text: In NdO0.5F0.5BiS2, Pt is coincident with a semiconductor-metal transition.

claim_0169.claim_text: Muon-spin-spectroscopy measurements on Bi4O4S3 reveal a very low superfluid density.

claim_0170.claim_text: The temperature dependence of the penetration depth in Bi4O4S3 possibly suggests the existence of two s-wave type energy gaps with zero-temperature values of 0.93(3) and 0.09(4) meV.

claim_0171.claim_text: The upturn in the temperature dependence of the upper critical field close to Tc in Bi4O4S3 further supports multi-gap superconductivity.

physical_attributes.Subject: Bi4O4S3
physical_attributes.Driver: Upturn in upper critical field near Tc

claim_0172.claim_text: Resistivity and µSR measurements on Bi4O4S3 determined the absolute value of the upper critical field, Hc2(0) = 15.3(4) kOe.

claim_0173.claim_text: The Hc2(T) data in Bi4O4S3 shows a positive curvature close to Tc, which is a sign of multi-gap superconductivity.

physical_attributes.Subject: Bi4O4S3

physical_attributes.Subject: Bi4O4S3

claim_0176.claim_text: Theoretical works, such as first principles band structure calculations and RPA analysis of a two-orbital model for BiS2-based superconductors, predict the presence of two superconducting gaps in Bi4O4S3.

claim_0181.claim_text: The ratio 2Δ_s/kBTc is 16.8 in NdO1-xFxBi1-yS2 single crystals, which is significantly larger than the theoretical value of 3.5 in the weak coupling limit of the BCS model.

claim_0418.claim_text: The one-dimensional three-orbital model, when solved self-consistently, produces a superconducting dome with a maximum Tc at the right chemical potential and a sizable increase in Tc when the magnitude of the hoppings is increased.

claim_0419.claim_text: Multi-gap superconductivity is required in the one-dimensional three-orbital model to satisfy the experimental constraints, and one of the hoppings has a dominant influence over the increase of Tc with pressure.

physical_attributes.Subject: One-dimensional three-orbital model
physical_attributes.Effect: Multi-gap superconductivity, dominant influence of hopping on Tc increase with pressure

claim_0420.claim_text: X-ray diffraction measurements showed that the LaOBiSSe samples obtained were weakly oriented.

claim_0421.claim_text: The resistivity (r) and Seebeck coefficient (S) of the LaOBiSSe samples are dependent upon the orientation of the crystal structure.

claim_0422.claim_text: The power factor (S2/r) measured perpendicular to the pressing direction (P1) in LaOBiSSe samples was higher than that measured parallel to the pressing direction (P2).

claim_0423.claim_text: The thermal conductivity (k) of LaOBiSSe samples was sensitive to the orientation.

claim_0424.claim_text: The values of k measured along P2 in LaOBiSSe samples were lower than that measured along P1.

claim_0425.claim_text: The highest figure-of-merit (ZT) of approximately 0.36 was obtained at around 650 K in both directions, i.e., P1 and P2, in LaOBiSSe samples.

physical_attributes.Subject: LaOBiSSe samples
physical_attributes.Effect: Highest ZT of 0.36 at 650 K in both P1 and P2

claim_0426.claim_text: Partial substitution of Pb for Bi in NdO0.7F0.3BiS2 enhances the superconducting transition temperature (Tc).

claim_0427.claim_text: The Tc of NdO0.7F0.3BiS2 increases with increasing Pb concentration up to 6%.

claim_0428.claim_text: The maximum Tc of NdO0.7F0.3BiS2 achieved by Pb substitution is 5.6 K.

claim_0429.claim_text: Pb substitution for Bi in NdO0.7F0.3BiS2 induces lattice shrinkage along the c axis.

physical_attributes.Subject: NdO0.7F0.3BiS2
physical_attributes.Effect: Lattice shrinkage along the c axis

claim_0430.claim_text: The enhancement of Tc in NdO0.7F0.3BiS2 is attributed to the change in lattice contraction along the c axis.

physical_attributes.Subject: NdO0.7F0.3BiS2
physical_attributes.Driver: Lattice contraction along the c axis

claim_0431.claim_text: R(O,F)BiS2 (R: La, Ce, Pr, Nd) superconducting single crystals with different F concentrations are grown using a CsCl/KCl flux.

claim_0432.claim_text: The obtained 1-2 mm-sized single crystals have a plate-like shape and are cleavable along the ab-plane.

physical_attributes.Subject: R(O,F)BiS2 (R: La, Ce, Pr, Nd) single crystals

claim_0433.claim_text: The crystal structure is tetragonal of space group P4/nmm (#129).

physical_attributes.Subject: R(O,F)BiS2 (R: La, Ce, Pr, Nd) single crystals

claim_0434.claim_text: The as-grown single crystals exhibit superconductivity at around 3-5 K.

physical_attributes.Subject: R(O,F)BiS2 (R: La, Ce, Pr, Nd) single crystals

claim_0435.claim_text: The superconducting transition temperature increases with decreasing the ionic radius of the R element.

physical_attributes.Subject: R(O,F)BiS2 (R: La, Ce, Pr, Nd) single crystals
physical_attributes.Driver: Decreasing ionic radius of R element

claim_0436.claim_text: The superconducting anisotropies of the R(O,F)BiS2 single crystals are estimated to be 30-60 according to the effective mass model.

claim_0437.claim_text: The anisotropies for Ce(O,F)BiS2 single crystals are 13-21.

claim_0438.claim_text: The c-axis transport measurements of a single crystal of Pr(O,F)BiS2 under a magnetic field parallel to the ab-plane reveal a "lock-in" state attributed to the Josephson vortex flow.

physical_attributes.Subject: Pr(O,F)BiS2 single crystal
physical_attributes.Driver: Magnetic field parallel to the ab-plane
physical_attributes.Effect: "Lock-in" state due to Josephson vortex flow

claim_0439.claim_text: Ce(O,F)BiS2 single crystals exhibit a magnetic order at the temperature range of 5-7 K that apparently coexist with superconductivity below approximately 3 K.

physical_attributes.Subject: Ce(O,F)BiS2 single crystals
physical_attributes.Effect: Magnetic order (5-7 K) and superconductivity (below 3 K)

claim_0440.claim_text: First-principles total energy and stability calculations confirm that the centrosymmetric P4/nmm structure previously assigned to LaOBiS2 is incorrect because a phonon instability renders this structure impossible.

claim_0441.claim_text: First-principles total energy and stability calculations find that the unstable P4/nmm structure in LaOBiS2 is replaced by a family of energetically closely spaced modifications (polytypes) differing by layer sequences and orientations.

claim_0442.claim_text: The local Bi-S distortion in LaOBiS2 leads to three polytypes with different stacking patterns of the distorted BiS2 layers.

physical_attributes.Subject: LaOBiS2
physical_attributes.Effect: Three polytypes with different BiS2 layer stacking

claim_0443.claim_text: The energy difference between the polytypes of LaOBiS2 is merely ~1 meV/u.c., indicating the possible coexistence of all polytypes in a real sample.

claim_0444.claim_text: The in-plane distortion in LaOBiS2 can be suppressed by pressure, leading to a phase transition from polytypes to the high-symmetry P4/nmm structure at a pressure larger than 2.5 GPa.

physical_attributes.Subject: LaOBiS2
physical_attributes.Effect: Phase transition from polytypes to P4/nmm structure

claim_0445.claim_text: Different choices of intermediate atoms (replacing La) or active atoms (BiS2) in LaOBiS2-family materials can manifest different ground state structures.

claim_0446.claim_text: Thermal conductivity κ of NdO0.71F0.29BiS2 shows only a very small residual linear term in κ_{0}/T at T → 0.

physical_attributes.Subject: NdO0.71F0.29BiS2
physical_attributes.Effect: Small residual linear term in κ_{0}/T at T → 0

claim_0447.claim_text: Applied magnetic field hardly affects the thermal conductivity of NdO0.71F0.29BiS2 in the wide range of the vortex state.

physical_attributes.Subject: NdO0.71F0.29BiS2
physical_attributes.Effect: No significant change in thermal conductivity

claim_0448.claim_text: Thermal conductivity κ/T of NdO0.71F0.29BiS2 does not show a discernible anomaly at Tc.

physical_attributes.Subject: NdO0.71F0.29BiS2
physical_attributes.Effect: No discernible anomaly in κ/T at Tc

claim_0449.claim_text: Electron correlation effect in NdO0.71F0.29BiS2 is not strong.

claim_0450.claim_text: Electron-phonon coupling in NdO0.71F0.29BiS2 is not strong.

claim_0451.claim_text: Doped band insulators, including HfNCl, WO_3, diamond, Bi_2Se_3, \bis2 families, STO/LAO interface, gate doped SrTiO_3 and MoS_2, are unusual superconductors.

claim_0452.claim_text: The maximum Tc in \laofx is only ~ 11 K.

claim_0453.claim_text: A number of experimental results in \laofx are puzzling and anomalous; they resemble high Tc and unconventional superconductors.

claim_0454.claim_text: Using a two orbital model of Usui, Suzuki and Kuroki, the authors show that the uniform low density free fermi sea in \laofh is unstable towards formation of next nearest neighbor Bi-S-Bi diagonal valence bond (charge -2e Cooper pair) and their Wigner crystallization.

claim_0455.claim_text: Instability to the novel state of matter in \laofh is caused by unscreened nearest neighbor coulomb repulsions (V ~ 1 eV) and a hopping pattern with sulfur mediated diagonal next nearest neighbor Bi-S-Bi hopping t' ~ 0.88 eV, larger than nearest neighbor Bi-Bi hopping, t ~ 0.16 eV.

claim_0456.claim_text: Wigner crystal of Cooper pairs quantum melts for doping around x = 0.5 and stabilizes certain resonating valence bond states and superconductivity.

claim_0457.claim_text: The authors studied few variational RVB states and suggest that \bis2 family members are latent high Tc superconductors, but challenged by competing orders and fragile nature of manybody states sustained by unscreened Coulomb forces.

claim_0458.claim_text: One of the superconducting states has dxy symmetry and a gap.

claim_0459.claim_text: The authors predict a 2d Bose metal or vortex liquid normal state, as charge -2e valence bonds survive in the normal state.

claim_0460.claim_text: The novel aspect of the work is the organization of a dilute fermi sea in a band insulator, into states containing certain diagonal valence bonds (charge -2e Cooper pairs).

claim_0461.claim_text: These states range from Cooper pair Wigner crystal to weakly coupled array of 1d Mott-Hubbard chains.

claim_0462.claim_text: The family of states suggested could support isotropic as well as anisotropic 2d Kosterlitz-Thouless superconductivity.

claim_0463.claim_text: It is likely both occur in different members of the BiS2 family for different ranges of parameters.

claim_0464.claim_text: Self organization, as suggested, makes onsite coulomb repulsion important, while trying to avoid near neighbor coulomb repulsions.

claim_0465.claim_text: It is a delicate interplay between onsite interaction and residual long range coulomb interactions, that leads to doped Mott physics and superconductivity.

claim_0466.claim_text: In the Cooper pair Wigner crystal phase we have proposed, a disorder free LaO0,5F0.5BiS2 is likely to be an insulator.

claim_0467.claim_text: Deviation away from x = 0.5 will act like a doping parameter.

claim_0468.claim_text: Disorder could quantum melt and create superconductivity even for x = 0.5.

claim_0469.claim_text: It will be interesting to see if the superconducting dome, currently observed around x = 0.5, develops a dip around x = 0.5 in superconducting Tc as a function of x, with decrease in disorder.

claim_0470.claim_text: Diagonal valence bond singlets Bi-S-Bi play a fundamental role in our theory.

claim_0471.claim_text: Topological defects in the generalized Wigner crystal may contain a finite density of unpaired spins (spinons) through broken diagonal valence bonds.

claim_0472.claim_text: This may lead to low temperature Curie contribution to spin susceptibility.

claim_0473.claim_text: In the present paper we have only focussed on certain simple energy minimizing generalized Wigner crystal states.

claim_0474.claim_text: A closer look suggests that a variety of ordering of diagonal singlets, with closeby energies are possible.

claim_0475.claim_text: Se substitution selectively occupies the in-plane Ch1 site in LaOBiS2-xSex.

claim_0476.claim_text: Se substitution induces buckling of the Bi-Ch1 plane in LaOBiS2-xSex.

claim_0477.claim_text: Se substitution enhances metallic conductivity and the thermoelectric power factor of LaOBiS2-xSex.

physical_attributes.Subject: LaOBiS2-xSex
physical_attributes.Effect: Enhancement of metallic conductivity and thermoelectric power factor

claim_0478.claim_text: The enhancement of the power factor in LaOBiS2-xSex is attained owing to the increased in-plane chemical pressure caused by Se substitution.

physical_attributes.Subject: LaOBiS2-xSex
physical_attributes.Driver: Increased in-plane chemical pressure (due to Se substitution)

claim_0479.claim_text: LaOBiSSe exhibits anomalously large atomic displacement parameters (Uiso) for Bi and Ch atoms in the BiCh2 conduction layers.

physical_attributes.Subject: LaOBiSSe
physical_attributes.Effect: Anomalously large Uiso for Bi and Ch atoms in BiCh2 layers

claim_0480.claim_text: The temperature dependences of Uiso suggest that the temperature evolutions of the atomic vibrations of the Bi-Ch1 plane in the BiCh2 layers in LaOBiSSe are anomalous and similar to that of the rattling atoms in a cage structure.

physical_attributes.Subject: LaOBiSSe
physical_attributes.Effect: Anomalous temperature evolution of atomic vibrations in Bi-Ch1 plane

claim_0481.claim_text: Bi atoms exhibit large atomic displacement along the c-axis direction in LaOBiSSe above 300 K.

physical_attributes.Subject: LaOBiSSe
physical_attributes.Effect: Large Bi atomic displacement along c-axis above 300 K

claim_0482.claim_text: The large Bi vibration along the c-axis direction in LaOBiSSe could be the origin of the low thermal conductivity.

claim_0483.claim_text: The BiCh2 based superconductors are a group of layered superconductors constructed from the pyramidal BiCh2 bilayers, and blocking layers having tetragonal structure.

claim_0484.claim_text: In 1112 systems, electrons can be doped into the BiCh plane with fluorine substitution for oxygen.

claim_0485.claim_text: The conduction bands consist of the p orbitals within the BiCh plane.

claim_0486.claim_text: The conduction bands and the Fermi surface therefore have one dimensional nature with small hoppings along the vertical directions.

claim_0487.claim_text: The irreducible susceptibility is enhanced along the (q, q,0) line due to the Fermi surface nesting and its one dimensional nature.

claim_0488.claim_text: The calculated phonon dispersion in the tetragonal lattice structure also shows the soft phonon modes along the (q, q,0) line.

claim_0489.claim_text: The first principles electronic band calculation results are overall in good agreement with the ARPES experiment, suggesting absence of strong electron correlation as in the 3d-based layered superconductors.

claim_0490.claim_text: Tc values comparable to the experimental observations have been obtained within the phonon-mediated pairing owing to the strong electron-phonon coupling.

claim_0491.claim_text: The synthesis of Sr0.5La0.5FBiSe2 via solid state reaction resulted in a superconducting transition temperature (Tc) of 3.8 K.

claim_0492.claim_text: Sr0.5La0.5FBiSe2 exhibits a strong diamagnetic signal below Tc in susceptibility ?(T) measurements, indicating bulk superconductivity.

claim_0493.claim_text: Sr0.5La0.5FBiSe2 displays metallic behavior in its normal state down to Tc, unlike most BiS2-based compounds which exhibit a semiconducting-like normal state.

physical_attributes.Subject: Sr0.5La0.5FBiSe2
physical_attributes.Effect: Metallic behavior in the normal state

claim_0494.claim_text: Under weak magnetic field or pressure, Sr0.5La0.5FBiSe2 undergoes a crossover from metallic to insulating behavior around Tmin, where resistivity exhibits a local minimum.

physical_attributes.Subject: Sr0.5La0.5FBiSe2
physical_attributes.Effect: Crossover from metallic to insulating behavior, local minimum in resistivity at Tmin

claim_0495.claim_text: Increasing pressure monotonously decreases Tc in Sr0.5La0.5FBiSe2.

claim_0496.claim_text: Increasing pressure up to 2.5 GPa first decreases and then increases the absolute value of the normal state resistivity at low temperatures in Sr0.5La0.5FBiSe2.

physical_attributes.Subject: Sr0.5La0.5FBiSe2
physical_attributes.Effect: First decrease, then increase in absolute value of normal state resistivity at low temperatures

claim_0497.claim_text: Single-crystalline CeOBiS2 exhibited zero resistivity below 1.2 K.

claim_0498.claim_text: Poly-crystalline CeOBiS2 exhibited zero resistivity below 1.2 K.

claim_0499.claim_text: Poly-crystalline LaOBiS2 did not show zero resistivity down to 0.13 K.

claim_0500.claim_text: Poly-crystalline PrOBiS2 did not show zero resistivity down to 0.13 K.

claim_0501.claim_text: The superconducting transition temperature of CeOBiS2 was reduced by increasing the applied current density.

claim_0502.claim_text: The superconductivity of CeOBiS2 without chemical doping is likely triggered by the carriers induced by the valence fluctuation between Ce3+ and Ce4+.

claim_0503.claim_text: With increasing Se concentration in Eu0.5La0.5FBiS2-xSex, in-plane chemical pressure is enhanced.

claim_0504.claim_text: For Se concentrations of x = 0.6, 0.8, and 1 in Eu0.5La0.5FBiS2-xSex, superconducting transitions with a large shielding volume fraction are observed in magnetic susceptibility measurements.

physical_attributes.Subject: Eu0.5La0.5FBiS2-xSex

claim_0505.claim_text: The highest Tc of 3.8 K is observed for x = 0.8 in Eu0.5La0.5FBiS2-xSex.

claim_0506.claim_text: With increasing Se concentration in Eu0.5La0.5FBiS2-xSex, the characteristics of electrical resistivity changes from semiconducting-like to metallic.

physical_attributes.Effect: Change in electrical resistivity characteristics from semiconducting-like to metallic

claim_0507.claim_text: The emergence of bulk superconductivity in Eu0.5La0.5FBiS2-xSex is linked with the enhanced metallicity via in-plane chemical pressure.

physical_attributes.Subject: Eu0.5La0.5FBiS2-xSex
physical_attributes.Driver: Enhanced metallicity via in-plane chemical pressure

claim_0508.claim_text: EuBiS2F exhibits superconductivity at 0.3 K without extrinsic doping.

claim_0509.claim_text: Substituting 50 at.% Ce for Eu in EuBiS2F enhances superconductivity, increasing Tc to 2.2 K.

claim_0510.claim_text: The valence of Eu ions in EuBiS2F is estimated to be +2.16(1), indicating self-electron-doping without extrinsic doping.

claim_0511.claim_text: Upon 50 at.% Ce-doping, the mean valence of Eu reduces to +2.05(1) and the valence of Ce ions is essentially trivalent.

claim_0512.claim_text: Ce-doping provides an additional 17% electrons into the EuBiS2F system, which is beneficial for superconductivity enhancement.

claim_0513.claim_text: The in-plane Bi-S1 distance in EuBiS2F-based systems exhibits large configurational disorder, a common feature in BiS2-based superconductors.

claim_0514.claim_text: Shortening of the in-plane Bi-S1 bond (higher in-plane chemical pressure) and a flatter Bi-S1 plane contribute to superconductivity enhancement in EuBiS2F.

claim_0515.claim_text: Electron carriers are doped to the BiS2 layer in Eu0.5La0.5FBiS2-xSex by the substitution of Eu by La.

physical_attributes.Subject: Eu0.5La0.5FBiS2-xSex
physical_attributes.Effect: Doping of electron carriers to the BiS2 layer

claim_0516.claim_text: Bulk superconductivity in Eu0.5La0.5FBiS2-xSex is induced by increasing the in-plane chemical pressure, which is controlled by the Se concentration (x).

claim_0517.claim_text: The precise determination of the structural parameters and thermal factors suggest that the emergence of bulk superconductivity in Eu0.5La0.5FBiS2-xSex is achieved by the enhanced in-plane chemical pressure and the decrease in in-plane disorder.

physical_attributes.Subject: Eu0.5La0.5FBiS2-xSex
physical_attributes.Driver: Enhanced in-plane chemical pressure and decreased in-plane disorder

claim_0518.claim_text: Synchrotron X-ray diffraction and Rietveld refinements with anisotropic displacement parameters reveal that the in-plane disorder in the BiSSe layer is fully suppressed for all x in LaO1-xFxBiSSe.

claim_0519.claim_text: In LaO1-xFxBiSSe, metallic conductivity and superconductivity are suddenly induced by electron doping even at x = 0.05 and 0.1 with a monoclinic structure.

physical_attributes.Subject: LaO1-xFxBiSSe
physical_attributes.Effect: Induction of metallic conductivity and superconductivity

claim_0520.claim_text: The x (F concentration) dependence of the transition temperature (Tc) for x = 0.2-0.5 with a tetragonal structure shows an anomalously flat phase diagram in LaO1-xFxBiSSe.

claim_0521.claim_text: In an ideal BiCh2-based compound with less in-plane disorder, metallic transport and superconductivity are suddenly induced by a small amount of electron doping.

physical_attributes.Subject: Ideal BiCh2-based compound
physical_attributes.Effect: Induction of metallic transport and superconductivity

claim_0522.claim_text: For LaO1-xFxBiSSe, superconductivity is induced in both monoclinic and tetragonal structures.

physical_attributes.Effect: Characterization by X-ray diffraction and EPMA

claim_0525.claim_text: The superconducting transition temperature with zero resistivity of La(O0.54F0.46)(Bi0.92Cd0.08)S2 was 2.3 K.

claim_0526.claim_text: Cd doping does not change the superconducting anisotropy so much, albeit the considerable suppression of Tc.

physical_attributes.Subject: La(O,F)BiS2
physical_attributes.Effect: Minimal change in anisotropy, considerable suppression of Tc

claim_0527.claim_text: Se substitution for both in-plane and out-of-plane Ch sites in Eu0.5Ce0.5FBiS2-xSex causes both lattice constants, a and c, to increase.

claim_0530.claim_text: The highest superconducting transition temperature (Tc) of 3.5 K was obtained for x = 0.6 in Eu0.5Ce0.5FBiS2-xSex.

claim_0533.claim_text: Neutron diffraction revealed site selectivity of Bi and Pb in the LaOBiPbS3 structure.

claim_0534.claim_text: The crystal structure of LaOBiPbS3 can be regarded as alternate stacks of the rock-salt-type Pb-rich sulfide layers and the LaOBiS2-type Bi-rich layers.

physical_attributes.Subject: LaOBiPbS3

physical_attributes.Subject: (LaOBiS2)(PbS) system

claim_0536.claim_text: Stacking rock-salt type sulfide (chalcogenide) layers and BiS2-based layered structures can modify the electronic structure.

physical_attributes.Subject: Rock-salt sulfide layers and BiS2-based layers

claim_0537.claim_text: Magnetization and electrical resistivity measurements on LaO0.6F0.4Bi(S,Se)2 samples with 76Se and 80Se isotopes did not reveal changes in Tc.

claim_0538.claim_text: The exponent αSe for LaO0.6F0.4Bi(S,Se)2 is close to zero.

claim_0539.claim_text: Pairing in LaO0.6F0.4Bi(S,Se)2 is not mediated by phonons.

claim_0540.claim_text: Unconventional superconductivity may emerge in the BiCh2 layer of LaO0.6F0.4Bi(S,Se)2.

claim_0541.claim_text: Metallic conductivity was observed for La1-xCexOBiSSe with x > 0.1 due to electron carriers induced by mixed valence of Ce ions.

claim_0542.claim_text: Zero resistivity and clear diamagnetic susceptibility were obtained for La1-xCexOBiSSe with x = 0.2-0.6, indicating the emergence of bulk superconductivity in these compounds.

claim_0543.claim_text: A dome-shaped superconductivity phase diagram with the highest transition temperature (Tc) of 3.1 K was established for La1-xCexOBiSSe.

claim_0544.claim_text: The mixed valence of Ce ions can be utilized as an alternative approach for electron-doping in layered bismuth-chalcogenides to induce superconductivity.

claim_0545.claim_text: Specific heat measurements on a single crystal of LaO0.5F0.5BiSSe reveal a clear jump at 3.95 K, suggesting bulk superconductivity in LaO0.5F0.5BiSSe.

claim_0546.claim_text: ΔC_\mathrm{e}/γT_\mathrm{c} and 2Δ(0)/k_\mathrm{B}T_\mathrm{c} are 2.31 and 4.5, respectively, in LaO0.5F0.5BiSSe, indicating strong electron-phonon coupling superconductivity.

claim_0547.claim_text: The temperature (T) and magnetic-field (H) dependence of the electronic specific heat C_\mathrm{e}(T, H) suggests that superconductivity is fully gapped in LaO0.5F0.5BiSSe.

claim_0548.claim_text: µSR measurements of LaO0.5F0.5BiS2 show multiple SC gaps, while specific heat measurements of LaO0.5F0.5BiSSe are insensitive to light bands.

claim_0552.claim_text: The mean free path ℓab in LaO0.5F0.5BiSSe is calculated to be ∼10 nm, which is shorter than the coherence length ξab.

claim_0553.claim_text: Synchrotron X-ray diffraction and Rietveld refinement of La2O2Bi3AgS6 revealed a crystal structure with a P4/nmm space group, a = 4.0644(1) Å, and c = 19.412(1) Å.

claim_0555.claim_text: Electrical resistivity and Seebeck coefficient measurements suggest that the electronic states of La2O2Bi3AgS6 are more metallic than those of LaOBiS2 and LaOBiPbS3.

claim_0556.claim_text: Decreasing the RE3+ ionic radius in REO0.5F0.5BiS2 (RE = La, Ce, Pr, and Nd) causes the lattice constant a and the in-plane Bi-S1 distance to monotonically decrease.

physical_attributes.Driver: Suppression of in-plane disorder at chalcogen sites

claim_0559.claim_text: The amplitude of the one-dimensional vibration of S1 (or Ch1) along the c-axis is correlated with Tc in BiCh2-based superconductors.

claim_0640.claim_text: Polycrystalline samples of Sr1-xRExFBiS2 (RE: La, Ce, Pr, Nd, and Sm) exhibit superconductivity at transition temperatures (Tc) within the range of 2.1-2.7 K under ambient pressure.

claim_0642.claim_text: Applying an external hydrostatic pressure induces bulk superconductivity in Sr1-xRExFBiS2 with a Tc of 2.5-2.8 K (low-P phase).

claim_0643.claim_text: A high-P phase with bulk superconducting characteristics and a Tc of 10.0-10.8 K is observed in Sr1-xRExFBiS2 at higher pressures.

claim_0644.claim_text: The critical pressure for the emergence of the high-P phase in Sr1-xRExFBiS2 increases with decreasing ionic radius of the doped RE ions.

claim_0645.claim_text: A structural phase transition from tetragonal to monoclinic occurs in Sr0.5La0.5FBiS2 at approximately 1.1 GPa.

claim_0646.claim_text: The structural transition in Sr0.5La0.5FBiS2 at 1.1 GPa indicates a pressure-induced superconducting-superconducting transition similar to the transition in LaO0.5F0.5BiS2.

claim_0647.claim_text: Applying external hydrostatic pressure induces bulk superconducting phases in Sr0.5RE0.5FBiS2.

claim_0648.claim_text: The Tc of the low-P phase in Sr0.5RE0.5FBiS2 slightly decreases with increasing pressure for RE = Ce, Pr, Nd, and Sm.

claim_0649.claim_text: The Tc of the high-P phase in Sr0.5RE0.5FBiS2 varies slightly with the RE ionic radius.

claim_0650.claim_text: The Pc for the high-P phase in Sr0.5RE0.5FBiS2 increases with decreasing RE ionic radius.

claim_0651.claim_text: The Tc of the high-P phase in REO0.5F0.5BiS2 compounds varies from approximately 10 K to 6 K with decreasing RE ionic radius.

claim_0652.claim_text: A higher Pc is required for REO0.5F0.5BiS2 compounds with decreasing RE ionic radius.

claim_0653.claim_text: The relationship between the structural transition to monoclinic and the packing density in the BiS2 conducting layers is highlighted.

claim_0654.claim_text: The larger space along the BiS conduction plane with a larger RE ionic radius possibly transmits pressure, thereby inducing a structural transition.

claim_0655.claim_text: A slightly increasing trend in Tc was observed for both low- and high-P phases of Sr0.5RE0.5FBiS2 with increasing lattice constant a estimated under ambient pressure.

claim_0656.claim_text: The lattice constant c of Sr0.5La0.5FBiS2 shrinks due to pressure, as indicated by shifts of the (001) and (004) peaks to higher angles in X-ray diffraction patterns.

claim_0657.claim_text: The in-plane size of Sr0.5La0.5FBiS2 remains almost unchanged under pressure, as indicated by a relatively smaller shift of the (110) peak in X-ray diffraction patterns.

claim_0658.claim_text: Strong peak broadening of the (200) peak in Sr0.5La0.5FBiS2 above 1.1 GPa indicates peak splitting due to the lowering of in-plane structural symmetry.

claim_0659.claim_text: The critical pressure of 1.1 GPa estimated from XRD corresponds satisfactorily with the Pc estimated from the magnetization measurements.

claim_0703.claim_text: The Grüneisen parameter (γG) exhibits a larger value when the Se concentration (x) is greater than 0.4 in LaO0.5F0.5BiS2-xSex.

claim_0704.claim_text: The increase of lattice anharmonicity is preferable for superconductivity in LaO0.5F0.5BiS2-xSex.

claim_0705.claim_text: A positive correlation between γG and Tc is revealed for Se-poor samples of REO0.5F0.5BiS2 (RE = Pr, Nd).

physical_attributes.Subject: REO0.5F0.5BiS2 (RE = Pr, Nd)
physical_attributes.Effect: Positive correlation between γG and Tc

claim_0706.claim_text: Electrical resistivity and Hall coefficients for Se-poor LaO1-xFxBiS2-ySey samples increase with decreasing temperature.

physical_attributes.Subject: LaO1-xFxBiS2-ySey (Se-poor)
physical_attributes.Effect: Increase in electrical resistivity and Hall coefficients

claim_0707.claim_text: The increase in electrical resistivity and Hall coefficients with decreasing temperature becomes less pronounced with increasing Se concentration in LaO1-xFxBiS2-ySey.

physical_attributes.Subject: LaO1-xFxBiS2-ySey
physical_attributes.Effect: Less pronounced increase in electrical resistivity and Hall coefficients

claim_0708.claim_text: Moderately Se-substituted LaO1-xFxBiS2-ySey samples exhibit metallic behavior in the high-temperature region and a weak increase in resistivity in the low-temperature regions.

physical_attributes.Subject: Moderately Se-substituted LaO1-xFxBiS2-ySey
physical_attributes.Effect: Metallic behavior in high-temperature region, weak increase in resistivity in low-temperature regions

claim_0709.claim_text: Heavily Se-substituted LaO1-xFxBiS2-ySey compounds show metallic behavior in the entire temperature region.

physical_attributes.Subject: Heavily Se-substituted LaO1-xFxBiS2-ySey
physical_attributes.Effect: Metallic behavior in entire temperature region

claim_0710.claim_text: Sign changes of the Hall coefficients are observed for x = 0.2 samples in LaO1-xFxBiS2-ySey, possibly related to a charge-density wave (CDW).

claim_0711.claim_text: Weak antilocalization (WAL) is realized in heavily Se-substituted LaO1-xFxBiS2-ySey systems.

claim_0712.claim_text: The WAL behavior in LaO1-xFxBiS2-ySey is weakened by changes in F and Se concentrations.

physical_attributes.Subject: LaO1-xFxBiS2-ySey
physical_attributes.Driver: Changes in F and Se concentrations

claim_0713.claim_text: A crossover state of WAL and weak localization (WL) emerges around moderately F-doped and Se-free LaO0.8F0.2BiS2.

claim_0714.claim_text: The change in magnetoconductance (MC) behavior by F and Se substitution correlates with the results of ρab (T) and RH (T) in LaO1-xFxBiS2-ySey.

claim_0715.claim_text: The localization regions of the WAL-WL crossover and weak WAL states are possibly associated with the CDW in LaO1-xFxBiS2-ySey.

claim_0716.claim_text: High-entropy alloy (HEA)-type REO0.5F0.5BiS2 exhibits a tetragonal-monoclinic transition at a pressure range similar to that for zero-entropy LaO0.5F0.5BiS2.

claim_0717.claim_text: Increasing RE-site configurational entropy does not induce robustness of Tc under high pressures in REO0.5F0.5BiS2.

physical_attributes.Subject: REO0.5F0.5BiS2
physical_attributes.Effect: No robustness of Tc under high pressures

claim_0718.claim_text: All samples of HEA-type REO0.5F0.5BiS2 exhibited clear decreases in Tc with increasing pressure in the monoclinic phase.

physical_attributes.Subject: HEA-type REO0.5F0.5BiS2 (RE = Pr, Ce0.5Nd0.5, Ce1/3Pr1/3Nd1/3, and La0.2Ce0.2Pr0.2Nd0.2Sm0.2)

claim_0719.claim_text: Sb substitution in CeOBiS2 single crystals grown using CsCl/KCl flux suppresses superconductivity.

claim_0720.claim_text: Sb substitution of more than approximately 4 atomic percent in the Bi-site of CeOBiS2 eliminates superconductivity at measurement temperatures above 0.36 K.

physical_attributes.Subject: CeOBiS2
physical_attributes.Driver: Sb substitution (more than 4 at% in Bi-site)

claim_0721.claim_text: A drastic change in the c-axis lattice parameter of CeOBiS2 is observed around an Sb substitution amount of approximately 4 atomic percent.

physical_attributes.Subject: CeOBiS2
physical_attributes.Effect: Drastic change in c-axis lattice parameter

claim_0722.claim_text: No relationship was found between Ce4+ ion concentrations and superconductivity in CeO(Bi, Sb)S2 superconductors.

claim_0723.claim_text: Sb- and Se-substituted CeOBiS2 single crystals [CeO(Bi, Sb)(S, Se)2] were successfully grown using CsCl/KCl flux.

claim_0724.claim_text: The superconducting transition temperature was measured for Sb- and Se-substituted CeOBiS2 [CeO(Bi, Sb)(S, Se)2] single crystals.

claim_0725.claim_text: A superconducting phase diagram with CSb < 0.18, CSe < 0.45 for CeOBiS2 was revealed.

physical_attributes.Subject: CeOBiS2
physical_attributes.Effect: Superconducting phase diagram with defined limits

claim_0726.claim_text: The boundary between superconductivity and non-superconductivity at above 0.3 K showed a non-linear line with a dome shape in the CSe = 0.15-0.30 region for CeOBiS2.

physical_attributes.Subject: CeOBiS2
physical_attributes.Effect: Non-linear boundary between superconducting and non-superconducting phases

claim_0727.claim_text: 12-year-old Bi4O4S3 samples exhibit bulk superconductivity with a slight degradation of the superconducting transition temperature (Tc) of 0.2 K.

claim_0728.claim_text: The high-pressure-synthesized LaO0.5F0.5BiS2 sample exhibits a clear decrease in Tc.

claim_0729.claim_text: High-pressure strain is reduced by aging in the LaO0.5F0.5BiS2 sample.

claim_0730.claim_text: The 10-years-old high-pressure-synthesized LaO0.5F0.5BiS2 sample exhibits aging effects on superconducting properties.
